title: How could boring old VAT scupper a Brexit deal?
text:
A draft Brexit deal is finally sealed but the champagne will be kept on ice. The subtleties of cross-border taxation could be part of the prime minister’s undoing at the final hurdle, according to the DUP.

The Northern Irish unionists pointed to a “lack of clarity on VAT” as a key concern stopping it backing Boris Johnson's tentative agreement with the EU over the terms of the UK's departure. With the PM lacking a majority in parliament, the DUP's 10 votes could make all the difference.

The party appears to have objected to details around Northern Ireland remaining in the EU’s VAT area. Currently businesses in the Republic of Ireland buying goods from a UK company are not charged value added...
